ticket.title: Cannot use table tables
ticket.original-body:
With scripts... Migration: create a database table called "tables". Model: create a model, table.rb. Controller: create a controller, tables_controller.rb
In the controller method create(), if you try to create an entry in the tables table by issuing (at first) @table = Table.new (for example) it does not resolve correctly to the correct (user) "Table" but I am supposing to some internal structure "Table" and you will get a wrong number of parameters error.
Curiously, if you start script/console, and type @table = Table.new it *will* resolve correctly.

Curiously, if you start script/console, and type @table = Table.new it will resolve correctly.

With scripts... Migration: create a database table called "tables". Model: create a model, table.rb. Controller: create a controller, tables_controller.rb

In the controller method create(), if you try to create an entry in the tables table by issuing (at first) @table = Table.new (for example) it does not resolve correctly to the correct (user) "Table" but I am supposing to some internal structure "Table" and you will get a wrong number of parameters error.

version.title: Cannot use table tables

version.body: Well this doesn't sound like a great idea, but if the problem is that it's not picking up the top level Table constant then you should be able to use ::Table
version.body-html: Well this doesn't sound like a great idea, but if the problem is that it's not picking up the top level Table constant then you should be able to use ::Table
version.title: Cannot use table tables

version.body: Fred is right, you need to use ::Table in that case.
version.body-html: Fred is right, you need to use ::Table in that case.
